derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English : from French asphalte, based on late Latin asphalton, asphaltum, from Greek asphalton

entry.def: Asphalt is a black substance used to make the surfaces of things such as roads and playgrounds.

means.word_mean: 1. mixed asphalt and crushed gravel or sand; used especially for paving but also for roofing
2. a dark bituminous substance found in natural beds and as residue from petroleum distillation; consists mainly of hydrocarbons
